sen.j: 8月のある日、激しい野分（台風）が都を吹き荒れた。
sen.e: One day in August, the capital was hit by a powerful nowaki (typhoon).

sen.j: 六条院の庭の草花も倒れ、そこへ訪れた夕霧 (源氏物語)は混乱の中で偶然紫の上の姿を垣間見、その美貌に衝撃を受ける。
sen.e: Yugiri, who visited the Rokujo-in Palace where plants and flowers in the garden were laid flat, caught a glimpse of Murasaki no ue in a mess by chance, and got shocked by her beauty.
sen.cmt: （源氏物語）はリンク先の言葉のため、訳出していません。
sen.e: On a visit to the Rokujo-in Palace, where plants and flowers in the garden had been blown flat, Yugiri happened to catch a glimpse of Murasaki no Ue amidst the chaos and was stunned by her beauty.

sen.j: その後祖母大宮 (源氏物語)の元へ見舞いに参上してからも、爛漫のサクラのような紫の上の艶姿は夕霧の脳裏に焼きついて消えなかった。
sen.e: Even after he paid a sympathetic visit to his grandmother, Omiya, he could not forget the beauty of Murasaki no ue which was like full-blown cherry blossoms.

sen.j: 野分の去った翌日、源氏は夕霧を連れて、宿下がり中の秋好中宮を始めとする女君たちの見舞いに回った。
sen.e: The next day of the typhoon, Genji visited ladies such as Empress Akikonomu, who was in the middle of a short leave, together with Yugiri.
The day after the typhoon, Genji and Yugiri went to vist Empress Akikonomu, who was in the middle of a short leave, and other noble ladies.

sen.j: 玉鬘 (源氏物語)の元を訪れた時、こっそりと覗き見た夕霧は玉鬘の美しさに見とれると共に、親子とは思えない振舞いを見せる源氏に驚き不審に思う。
sen.e: When they visited Tamakazura, Yugiri caught a glimpse of Tamakazura and was fascinated by her beauty, and at the same time, he was suspicious about Genji's behavior toward her, which was not like toward his daughter.

sen.j: とりどりに花のように美しい女性たちを思って心乱れつつ、雲居の雁へ文を送る夕霧だった。
sen.e: Yugiri, who lost his composure because of the various beauty of the women like flowers, sent Kumoi no Kari a letter.
